data.title: ConfigurationTarget constants in extension host do not match values in core
data.body: Those in the extension host start at 1, those in the core start at 0.

data.title: HTML Auto Close doesn't work with Multi Cursor
data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33294

![multicursor-autoclose](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/876920/29834284-37569924-8ca3-11e7-9513-199cf90d921d.gif)

* I would expect the second tag is auto closed as well
* If not, at least do not shrink selections to one.

data.title: Style tag doesn't auto close in HTML
data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33294

![styletag](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/876920/29833792-6af10dde-8ca1-11e7-9289-3747ecb84876.gif)

```
<html>

<body>
  <style></style>
```
Put the cursor after the closing `</style>`,  type `<style>` doesn't auto close.

data.title: `parse_block_html` for Markdown in VS Code?
data.body:
Is there something similar to `kramdown`s `parse_block_html: true` [1] in Visual Studio Code? Right now something like this: ```
Caution: This might at times cause problems with `foo` commands ...
``` is not parsed as markdown both in the editor and preview. [1] https://kramdown.gettalong.org/parser/kramdown.html#option-parse-block-html

data.title: Markdown preview link lost when new file is saved
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new, unsaved editor pane
2. Type some Markdown
3. Change language mode to Markdown
4. Click preview button to open the preview pane
5. Click back to the edit pane and save it as a file
6. Observe that the Markdown preview pane continues to show "Preview 'Untitled-1'" and will not reflect further edits to the file.

May be related to #12033

Screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8230981/29832384-e732df30-8c9c-11e7-9e69-bb031dc7fe57.png)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

data.title: Mime Extension Install: Reload Window Re-installs Extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code via a web link to install an extension
2. You are prompted to install
3. Extension is installed
4. Reload the window to activate
5. You will be prompted to install the same extension again
6. Assuming you opened VS Code for the first time this way every window reload will prompt for install until you close and restart VS Code

Expected - once installed you are not prompted to install again.

data.body:

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on a web link to install an already installed extension
2. You will be prompted to install the extension again

Expected - we check if the extension is already installed and display the extension details page vs the 'install extension' notification.

data.title: Unable to launch VS Code from terminal in Windows 10
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
I'm trying to follow the js guide from [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/nodejs-tutorial), where it says:
> Tip: You can open files or folders directly from the command line. The period '.' refers to the current folder, therefore VS Code will start and open the Hello folder. 

This produces this error however: 
![uten navn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9251274/29831829-a12580ca-8ce6-11e7-95e4-2dd8114ca348.png)

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 15063

Steps to Reproduce:
```
cd
mkdir hello
code .
```
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Any ideas how I can troubleshoot this?

data.title: Mime Extension Install: Window in background
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have VS Code in the background and loaded
2. Click on an `install extension` link
3. The window will remain in background with the notification to install

Expected - the window moved to the foreground when link is clicked.

data.title: Find definition on an item with multiple appears to animate the initial scroll when the peek view is displayed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (d0d00e882437092f521d2d7893cc56ee296d278f, 2017-08-29T06:58:13.897Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-32-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
lorem-ipsum|Tyr|1.0.0
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
vscode-svgviewer|css|1.4.2
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
git-project-manager|fel|1.4.0
md-navigate|jri|0.0.1
theme-monokai-pro-vscode|mon|1.0.1
vscode-scss|mrm|0.6.2
seti-icons|qin|0.1.3
Ruby|reb|0.15.0
vim|vsc|0.9.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

#33299 

1. Open vscode workspace
2. Open ./node_modules/typescript/lib/lib.d.ts
3. Scroll up such that `AnalyserNode` is on the screen (but below the middle)
4. Ctrl+click `AnalyserNode`

Observe:

- AnalyserNode is smooth scrolled to the middle of the editor. This is fine, but not in combination with:
- The peek view is displayed and its editor does not start on the definition, instead it animates a scroll from some random position.

data.body:

4. Ctrl+tab to switch back to terminalInstance.ts
5. Ctrl+click setTimeout

Observe that the expensive scroll on lib.d.ts still animates even though the user has already lost context on the lib.d.ts file.

data.title: Client should report current value of activeSignature to signatureHelpProvider
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro, version 1703 (x64)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Trigger signature help with multiple signatures
2. Manually change active signature
3. Type a non-separator character
4. Watch it revert to previously active signature

Reproduces without extensions: N/A

With the current value of `activeSignature` in the request, the `signatureHelpProvider` could more intelligently decide what the `activeSignature` value should be in its response. This is especially the case when both arguments are of the same data type and the provider cannot reasonably determine the active signature and must make it arbitrary.

Ref: #16256

data.title: Should smooth scrolling be applied when moving the cursor up one line?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (d0d00e882437092f521d2d7893cc56ee296d278f, 2017-08-29T06:58:13.897Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-32-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
lorem-ipsum|Tyr|1.0.0
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
vscode-svgviewer|css|1.4.2
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
git-project-manager|fel|1.4.0
md-navigate|jri|0.0.1
theme-monokai-pro-vscode|mon|1.0.1
vscode-scss|mrm|0.6.2
seti-icons|qin|0.1.3
Ruby|reb|0.15.0
vim|vsc|0.9.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

#33299

This might be as designed, but it looks a bit strange to me how smooth scrolling is enabled even when scrolling up a single line. When smooth scrolling is disabled the cursor position stays in a stable position, when it's enabled it keeps jumping back and forth between the bottom line and the one below it. Feels smoother when it's disabled imo.

data.title: Ability to search in open files only
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (d0d00e882437092f521d2d7893cc56ee296d278f, 2017-08-29T07:05:40.998Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063

It would be quite helpful to (optionally) limit the search to the open files only, even when a project/folder is open.

For example, I am working on some feature, adding TODOs here and there, and all files that I edited are naturally open. I'd like to search for all TODOs, but not in the entire project (there are thousands of TODOs in the big project), I'd like to limit the searches only to the currently opened files.

Currently, the UI in the Search tab provides a couple of buttons in "files to ignore" field ("Use Ignore Files" and "Use exclude settings").

I'd like to see a button in the "files to include" field, with similar styles as the two buttons above and named "Use Opened Files" or something like that.

Naturally, both ways should be possible, searching the entire project and searching only in the open files.

data.title: app.use(function *() {}) can not be saved successfully
data.body:
For example, i want to write the below simple code:
`app.use(function *() {
    this.body = 'hello world';
});
`

But after saving file, the code became to:
`app.use(function*() {
    this.body = 'hello world';
});
`
In fact, there is a space between the word 'function' and '*'.

data.title: Extension Recommendation: close event not fired
data.body:
Testing: #33298 

- Section Testing Telemetry for the Recommendation Pop up
- item 5: close the pop up

I didn't receive any event.  Verified by setting a break point in TelemetryService#publicLog.

data.title: Zen Mode is hard to use on modern wide screen monitors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (d0d00e882437092f521d2d7893cc56ee296d278f, 2017-08-29T07:05:40.998Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063

Basically, I can't use the Zen Mode on my wide screen 32-inch monitor, since all the code is on the very left side of the screen, while I (and I assume any other sane person working on computer) am usually positioned at the center of the screen, not on the far left.

It would be great if Zen Mode could support some kind of "centered" view, wen the text/code is centered in the middle, not on the very left.

data.title: Pressing enter converts spaces to tabs on current line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. ![a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80071/29824776-b09cc194-8cd2-11e7-97ec-aaac5a004c03.png)
2. Press enter
3. ![b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80071/29824779-b29579f0-8cd2-11e7-98dd-c22ee679fde5.png)

That it converts spaces to tabs on the new line (4) is a an old issue, but now it also converts the spaces to a tab on line 3! This is a regression as I don't remember this happening in  1.14.

Note that this even happens with `editor.autoIndent` set to `false`!

data.title: Explorer Tree View section doesn't disappear if EH dies
data.body:
testing #33300 on macOS:

- debug some code and open loaded scripts explorer
- kill EH from outside and restart EH

Observe: 
Loaded Scripts explorer tree disappears but the viewer header stays:

![2017-08-29_15-52-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29824525-15c7003a-8cd2-11e7-8748-7f8eb9c259e9.png)

data.title: Additional SCM views always shown
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Install the Perforce vscode extension
2. Notice that no matter what you have open the perferce split view is always shown in the scm views
3. Previously we would only show one and allow the user to choose between git / perferce

However now since the perforce extension is probably always getting registered it is constant noise no matter what repo I open.
Not sure how to solve this but something to be aware of

data.title: Code should validate relative path in workspace file and behave more gracefully
data.body: Testing: #33278 - create a workspace file with only relative paths - copy the file using OS means (file explorer) where the folder don't make any sense - open the file Observe: - you see the folder structure also not existing on disk - clicking on a folder shows an error message: I would have expected that the folders are rendered gray / disabled and that clicking on them shows me a better error message

data.title: Loaded Scripts explorer isn't restored after EH restart
data.body:
testing #33300 on macOS:

- debug some code and open loaded scripts explorer
- kill EH from outside and restart EH

Observe: 
Loaded Scripts explorer disappears but doesn't come back on restart.

data.title: Git split view not reacting to removal of files in no folder workspace
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Have a no folder workspace and open a file belonging to some git repo
2. Notice that repo is nicely shown in the git viewlet
3. Close that file from the no folder workspace and open git viewlet
4. I would expect the git viewlet is empty, instead it shows the git repository I am no longer interested in

data.title: Git split view titile label polish
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Currently if I open multiple git repositories in a MR workspace each has the title in the following form `GIT - NAME`
2. imho the following format would be better `NAME (GIT)`
3. When in a MR workspace I believe the name of the workspace is more imporant when distinguishing between different folders
Also for consitency we use brackets when saying something is a workspace or to which launch.json a configuration belongs to.

An advanced representation could be to just show the NAME and show the paranthesis only if there are different SCM providers in the workspace.

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 15 23 34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29823225-5ae85794-8cce-11e7-895f-760455688512.png)

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 15 26 56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29823310-9066542a-8cce-11e7-8f2d-e11a79100c72.png)
